channel.title: Can you tell me what kind of java knowledge I need? (My exp. inside thread)
channel.description:
I've been keen on starting java, let me give you a quick background.
I did java in high school, I know the basic commands. I understand object orientation, at least the basic part. I've coded in a few different languages. I use C, I've not used C++. I have made java code before, I've even made my own RS bot'ing scripts in java (but they sort of sucked, though I understood it... and it was based off of someone who made the bot and I was just a scripter). I've worked with enough code to understand the basics. I have no issue working with arrays, variables, two dimensions...etc. The issue of coding the idea I want is not a problem.
My only problem is where to go with terms of knowledge with respect to games like runescape. I want to understand the client, I want to be able to create my own game from scratch. Not that I'm going to do this, but if I understand how to make one from scratch, I can better understand the clients. I know absolutely nothing about server to computer communications besides it involving packets?
I'm reading online how to work with java, but I'm really stuck on how to proceed. Where should I focus on? What did you do, or what do you know that can help me (Ex: maybe you know some things I can do to make my knowledge greater in this area of gaming?). I do this for a hobby and it'll stay that way-- but I've got a lot of time on my hands for the moment. Should I get a java book? I'm going through oracle tutorials... but I don't think it'll prepare me for server communications and stuff like that. But at least I'll know more of the basics.
Hope that helps, can you help point me in the right direction? Thanks :)

item.title: Can you tell me what kind of java knowledge I need? (My exp. inside thread)
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Marine5287:

How the hell do you remember your username???

Read full topic
item.source: Can you tell me what kind of java knowledge I need? (My exp. inside thread)

item.title: Can you tell me what kind of java knowledge I need? (My exp. inside thread)
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:6, topic:395779”]I learned Java by simply looking at the RS2 client ( how it was coded ).
Start by looking at the main method in the main class ( = public static void main (String [] args]) ) and just follow the code to wherever it takes you

Other then that , there are a few shitton of books that teach you how to program in Java ( i suggest you go for books ).

Another option is online/irl lessons , but i don’t suggest this if you’re already going to school.[/quote]
Bullshit.

Read the protocol.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you tell me what kind of java knowledge I need? (My exp. inside thread)
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

I learned Java by simply looking at the RS2 client ( how it was coded ).
Start by looking at the main method in the main class ( = public static void main (String [] args]) ) and just follow the code to wherever it takes you

Other then that , there are a few shitton of books that teach you how to program in Java ( i suggest you go for books ).

Another option is online/irl lessons , but i don’t suggest this if you’re already going to school.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qawsedrftgyhujikol qawsedrftgyhujikol
item.description:
@qawsedrftgyhujikol wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:4, topic:395779”][quote author=qawsedrftgyhujikol link=topic=492971.msg3609933#msg3609933 date=1306467158]
I’ve been trying to learn C# and came across an awesome book to learn from. The company that makes this book makes a bunch of 800 page books on programming languages and such. Here’s the link to a Java one: http://www.headfirstlabs.com/books/hfjava/ The company also does JavaScript if your interested in that.
[/quote]
How the hell do you remember your username???[/quote]
It’s a pattern on my keyboard.

item.title: Can you tell me what kind of java knowledge I need? (My exp. inside thread)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

My suggestion is to make a very basic 2d game so you can get the feel of how touchy java can be when it comes to performace in games. Try something like mario or of the sorts, and work from there until you are comfortable with ut. Then try 3d. Remember, runescape classic is 2d on everthing except with 3d maps.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you tell me what kind of java knowledge I need? (My exp. inside thread)
